intro: Chrysocoma virgata, commonly known as the African silver bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, white flowers that are often clustered together, followed by orange or red fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
